So operating systems for for embedded systems can can be separated along 2 lines according to the scheduling model.
So first class is event driven operating event driven model which Contiki and Tiny OS are part of this model.

Even models which is free artios and not all sent equals and so on.

We operating system uses one stack which is reused for every event handler, and this one doesn't require so much memory and like as you can see in the figure on the right, each tasks.
Each task runs to completion.
In the second Model 1 task can be interrupted while higher priority tasks are executed and then after all the high priority tasks are executed you come back and finish the first task.
So in the second case, each thread has its own stack.
